While I’m not discrediting the fact that sodium bicarbonate is actually used in making soap, but that ABC fire extinguisher is actually using monoammonium phosphate and not sodium bicarbonate.I’m a certified fire extinguisher technician and I work with both types. ABC fire extinguishers do not use Sodium bicarbonate, only BC fire extinguishers do, as they aren’t rated for class A fires.

Fun video!  FYI:  Different oils make different types of lather.  Lard makes what are called "slow small bubbles". Coconut oil makes quick big bubbles.  I've been making Lard, Olive Oil, Coconut Oil soap for years.  The combination of oils makes an excellent lather. It's a terrific soap and very gentle on the skin.

Interesting fact
Soap was not used to wash hands or dishes in the beginning. It was actually used to wash wool after its been sheered off the sheep. It was a very commonly used item to use in the textile industry. Over time people started noticing it also works with removing (not killing) bacteria off the hands of a person. Eventually scientist did begin to put anti-bacterial stuff into soap to make it more affective as preventing the spread of germs. Kind of like the mask debate. Do I wear a mask and if so what kind of mask do I use? In the end there are many steps to resolving a problem. In reality there is no such thing as a perfect solution to any given problem. One of the biggest misunderstood facts about life is that both science and philosophy does contradict themselves. At the end of the day you have to ask, "what problem was I supposed to solve to begin with?" That is science
